intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. pilleri, commonly known as the mouse-ear hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
